text: alt=Anne Elizabeth Moore Anne Elizabeth Moore is an editor, artist, and is well known for her books Unmarketable: Brandalism, Copyfighting, Mocketing and the Erosion of Integrity,Mother Jones: Unmarketable: Brandalism, Copyfighting, Mocketing, and the Erosion of Integrity. November/December 2007.Anne Elizabeth Moore: Unmarketable and Hey Kidz, Buy This Book: A Radical Primer on Corporate and Governmental Propaganda and Artistic Activism for Short People.Anne Elizabeth Moore: Hey Kidz, Buy This Book: A Radical Primer on Corporate and Governmental Propaganda and Artistic Activism for Short People She has also been highlighted for her work in zines and comics. Moore's writing has been featured in a variety of publications,The Olympic (shell) games – Sports In Condemnation of Opting In – In These Times and Columbia College's Center for Book & Paper Arts presented a retrospective exhibition of Moore's zine art in 2009. Moore was the editor of the first compilation of Houghton Mifflin's Best American Comics series in 2006,Houston Chronicle: Dressing up the comics. October 15, 2006. as well as copublisher and editor of Punk Planet.Time Out Chicago: Write or wrong: Anne Elizabeth Moore brings Cambodian women's zines to ThreeWalls. March 3, 2009.Punk Planet Forever. December 6, 2005. Moore was educated at the University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire and the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, and currently teaches Visual and Critical Studies at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago.SAIC: Anne Elizabeth Moore. Moore was named editor-in-chief of the Chicago Reader in October 2018, replacing Mark Konkol.https://www.robertfeder.com/2018/10/01/anne-elizabeth-moore-named- editor-chicago-reader/ She abruptly departed the Reader in March 2019.https://www.robertfeder.com/2019/03/18/robservations-kris-kridel- stepping-back-wbbm-newsradio/ ==Awards== * 2019 Eisner Award for Best Academic/Scholarly Work for Sweet Little Cunt: The Graphic Work of Julie Doucet (Uncivilized Books) ==References== ==External links== * Category:American editors Category:Comics critics Category:Book artists Category:American contemporary artists Category:Webzine writers Category:American women essayists Category:American essayists Category:Living people Category:University of Wisconsin–Eau Claire alumni Category:School of the Art Institute of Chicago alumni Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:American women illustrators Category:American illustrators Category:Women book artists
title: Anne Elizabeth Moore
